articles.title: Everest Medicines Announces Exclusive License Agreement with Micot to Commercialize MT1013
articles.description: SHANGHAI, Feb. 5, 2026 /PRNewswire/ -- Everest Medicines (HKEX 1952.HK, 'Everest', or the 'Company'), a biopharmaceutical company focused on the discovery, clinical development, manufacturing, and commercialization of innovative therapeutics, today announced that it has entered into an exclusive license agreement with Shaanxi Micot Pharmaceutical Technology Co., Ltd. ('Micot') to commercialize MT1013, the world's first-in-class dual-targeting receptor agonist polypeptide that simultaneously targets the Calcium-Sensing Receptor (CaSR) and the Osteogenic Growth Peptide (OGP) receptor and is primarily developed with Secondary Hyperparathyroidism (SHPT) as its leading indication, in China and Asia-Pacific (excluding Japan).
articles.content: SHANGHAI, Feb. 5, 2026 /PRNewswire/ -- Everest Medicines (HKEX 1952.HK, "Everest", or the "Company"), a biopharmaceutical company focused on the discovery, clinical development, manufacturing, and commercialization of innovative therapeutics, today a... [10521 chars]

articles.title: Indoor air as ‘critical infrastructure’ in Make in India
articles.description: As Indian cities continue to grapple with hazardous air quality, Barcelona-based airtech firm Zonair3D is betting on medical-grade indoor air solutions to create pollution-free sanctuaries. With ULPA-certified technology and plans to localise manufacturing, the company is positioning indoor air as critical infrastructure for India’s urban future.
articles.content: Worsening air quality is not a new phenomenon in India. It has continued to drop to hazardous levels owing to industrialisation, urbanisation and shifting agricultural practices. Zonair3D, a Barcelona-based airtech firm, has introduced a unique appro... [2409 chars]

articles.title: Asia-Pacific Markets Fall Following Wall Street Tech Selloff and US-Iran Diplomatic Uncertainty
articles.description: Asia-Pacific markets declined broadly, with the KOSPI falling 1.7%, ASX 200 down 0.3%, and Nikkei 225 dropping 0.2%. The weakness followed Wall Street's technology selloff led by semiconductor shares, while markets also processed shifting headlines about US-Iran diplomatic talks that were initially reported as suspended before later resuming.
articles.content: Asia-Pacific equity markets closed predominantly lower as investors responded to continued weakness from Wall Street, where semiconductor stocks drove a broader technology sector selloff. The regional decline reflected growing concerns about the tech... [4308 chars]

articles.title: China to ban hidden car door handles
articles.description: HONG KONG — China will ban hidden door handles on cars, commonly used on Tesla’s electric vehicles and many other EV models, starting next year. All car doors must include a mechanical release function for handles, except for the tailgate, according to details released by China’s Ministry of Industry and Information Technology on Monday. Officials […]
articles.content:
HONG KONG — China will ban hidden door handles on cars, commonly used on Tesla’s electric vehicles and many other EV models, starting next year.
All car doors must include a mechanical release function for handles, except for the tailgate, according ... [494 chars]

articles.title: Arm Holdings shares fall as licensing sales miss estimates
articles.description: Feb 4 (Reuters) - Shares of Arm Holdings fell on Wednesday as its licensing revenues slightly missed ‌Wall Street estimates, despite a push by the company to boost the segment with new chip ‌technology designs.
articles.content:
Feb 4 (Reuters) - Shares of Arm Holdings fell on Wednesday as its licensing revenues slightly missed ‌Wall Street estimates, despite a push by the company to boost the segment with new chip ‌technology designs.
